Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and illustrate different types of habitats, such as land habitats (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream).
The student can draw various living things found in each habitat, including plants and animals like trees, grasses, bushes, lizards, squirrels, and fish.
The student can compare the diversity of living things in multiple habitats by showing different plants and animals in each drawing.
The student can observe and depict patterns in the natural world by identifying groups or types of living things that appear in similar habitats.
The student can use their drawing to provide evidence of plant and animal diversity across different habitats.
